title: Towards autonomous time-calibration of large quantum-dot devices: Detection, real-time feedback, and noise spectroscopy
summary: The performance and scalability of semiconductor quantum-dot (QD) qubits are limited by electrostatic drift and charge noise that shift operating points and destabilize qubit parameters. As systems expand to large one- and two-dimensional arrays, manual recalibration becomes impractical, creating a need for autonomous stabilization frameworks.
